full_summary:
===============

**Government Tender Announcement**

[English]
[English]

# Request for Proposal: Regravelling of Taxiway and Traffic Area, Waskaganish

[English]

## Purpose
This Contracting Authority announces a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the re-gravelling of the taxiway and traffic area (apron) at Waskaganish Airport, Waskaganish, Quebec.

## Details

* **Tender Reference Number**: PW-_MTC-080-16506
* **Publication Date**: August 31, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: September 26, 2022, 2:00 PM EST
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Selection Criteria**: Lowest Price

## Description
The work covered by this contract includes, but is not limited to, the provision of expertise, materials, equipment, labor, and all necessary requirements for the re-gravelling of the taxiway and traffic area (apron) at Waskaganish Airport.

## Mandatory Requirements
* The Bidder must ensure that all documents and attachments are in either English or French.
* Bid security must be enclosed with the bid.
* It is mandatory to submit a bid through Canada Post Corporation’s (CPC) Connect service.

## Conditions for Indigenous Businesses
* This tender may be reserved among Indigenous Businesses if two conditions are met:
	1. Bids from two or more Indigenous Businesses meet the mandatory requirements of this RFP.
	2. The bids received come from at least two Indigenous Businesses that meet the criteria of the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement (CLCA) entitled James Bay and Northern Quebec Agreement (JBNQA) - Cree Portion.

## Documents
* Tender documents are available on the Buy and Sell platform: https://buyandsell.gc.ca
* All inquiries should be submitted in writing to the Contractual Authority: Stephen Phan at stephen.phan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

## Notice
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Standard terms and conditions for this procurement are incorporated by reference into, and form part of, the tender and contract documents.

---

Note: The text has been revised to make it conform to the standard format of a government tender announcement. The changes made include:

* Reformatted the text using markdown
* Removed unnecessary information
* Standardized the formatting of section headings
* Simplified the
